name: Kildonan Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We upgraded to a suite, and it was well worth it for the lovely room and beautiful view, but I imagine most rooms here have a great view.
reviews.title: Lovely spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small hotels in very rural locations often struggle with staffing and profit, making existence a juggling act. Kildonan is managing these challenges well, and I'd happily return as it was very good value.
reviews.title: Breathtaking views

reviews.text: Others have mentioned the rooms being a nice surprise as the public rooms are less 'tasteful'. Everywhere is clean and decorated, although not the minimalist beige of many faceless larger chains, but quirky and individual.
reviews.title: Let down by the small things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good, and the 'ping' someone mentioned alleging that the breakfasts were reheated in the microwave was, in fact, the noise of the industrial toaster in the prep area next to the dining room in full view of diners. Assumptions of this sort can be damaging when read by potential customers, and I can assure future guests that the bacon was some of the best I have tasted, eggs were a fantastic free range yellow and Stornoway black pudding was on offer, all freshly and individually cooked rather than the mass-produced, self-service catering trays of larger hotels.
reviews.title: Stunning Views - Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly, atmosphere was relaxed, the bar was used by locals too and the 6 traditional musicians who came to play on the Saturday night provided a lovely touch. As mentioned by other reviewers, this is not a bar filled with comfy sofas, but it is used mainly by locals who are the bar's income all year round, and is the only place for locals to meet for many miles around. We had a good time listening to the live music and chatting to local people.
reviews.title: Perfect location and excellent food

reviews.text: Went with friends on a Groupon deal - great value, but I wouldn't have been pleased if I'd been paying full price. This place has got to be in one of the most stunning locations in Scotland, right on the beach with views to Pladda Island, Ailsa Craig and the Kintyre Peninsula. We were fortunate to get full advantage of the stunning location as the weather was lovely. Negative reviews and a poor review by Tam Cowan of the restuarant made us a little apprehensive but we went with an open mind. There are positives, but so many niggly things that just spoil the whole experience.
reviews.title: Shame, this place could be really special

reviews.text: Accommodation: we were allocated room 3, which has the spectular view, but might not suit all at it's directly above the bar so noise may be an issue. Room was lovely, recently decorated and very comfortable, however cleanliness could have been better - inch thick dust on the wooden blinds (one of which was broken) and the shower head desperately needed a good scrub with bleach. Also, it doesn't seem you can regulate temperature - it was cool when we went to bed, but heating came on during the night and it was far too warm.
reviews.title: Lovely rooms bad timing of visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: we had dinner the first night which was fine. I selected from the specials: black pudding/scallops which were nice, but a little dry, the confit duck was lovely with caramelised prunes/peppers, only the cold & lumpy mash let the dish down. My husband enjoyed his soup (no oil slick this time Tam) and the fish & chips. Breakfast, however, not so good - really very stingy. If you want anything other than orange juice you need to pay extra. You can't have both cereal and a cooked breakfast (where do you ever hear of that?), only 1 rasher of bacon & the lorne sausage was barely cooked, black pudding costs extra - everything else OK, not greasy at all. Service pretty slow (at dinner it was only the lady owner serving with the barmaid assisting with drinks), at breakfast I had tea, but the other 3 with me wanted coffee and small pot served - waited ages to attract attention and waited ages, we were about to leave when the girl eventually brought another pot of coffee. We didn't bother with breakfast 2nd day.
reviews.title: Groupon deal for two couples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception: often un-manned, place like the Marie Celeste, when checking out no-one at Reception and another couple were waiting to be seen, I just left the key there as we had pre-paid.
reviews.title: Location perfect, hotel just OK

reviews.text: Another issue we had was in the bar on the first night - before 11pm they asked us to go through to the lounge, said painter was coming in to work overnight and bar was closing. All the staff then disappeared, we didn't know there there wasn't a bar in the lounge, we weren't asked if we wanted any further drinks before the bar was closing. So we served ourselves and we/the painter (sorry Stevie if we got you into trouble) wrote a list of the drinks we'd had. The two men went to see the lady owner next morning to square up, she wasn't too pleased, but hey she'd made £50 more than she thought she had. At least we were honest, there could have been others who'd helped themselves and not said anything!
reviews.title: Great spot, average accommodation
Perfect weekend break
reviews.text: Just back from a weekend away at this lovely hotel, rooms were large enough and had great views, we ate at the hotel both nights and was very impressed with the service and standard of the food and presentation, the breakfasts were also very impressive, all in all had a great weekend and will go back again.

I love this hotel! It's warm, friendly and located on the beach. It's a good three star and doesn't try to be anything else......get the bus from Brodick ferry terminal, just 25 mins and costs just £2.80 each way. Wouldn't bother with taxis though, there are only four on the island and they are difficult to get hold of! Breakfast is amazing! The hotel has a great wee bar and pool table, shop with a good range of products and post office service at selected times.
reviews.title: Picture perfect setting with some of the friendliest staff I've ever met!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is definitely a reason to visit Arran!
reviews.title: Exceptional Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have known and visited the Kildonan Hotel for lunches for many years, previously having owned a static caravan on Arran which we no longer have. We therefore enjoyed this winter break to Arran but were in some ways disappointed in the hotel as residents. The room was comfortable enough and nicely furnished but lacked the standard of housekeeping we would have expected, with half the lightbulbs in the bathroom being u/s. Daily room cleaning procedures were obviously lax in that the base of the free-standing toilet roll holder had not been wiped, let alone polished, for months (at least). Rather than thorough floor cleaning dirt was literally being swept under the carpet!
reviews.title: Lovely experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were pleasant enough but were rather casually dressed and at times it was unclear which persons were staff and which were guests.
reviews.title: Kildonan Hotel, February 25th 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Groupon deal , and it was great we stayed there from the 10 Feb-12th. The room was lovely and clean and the view was great over looking the Ailsa Craig. We had lunch and evening dinner in the hotel which was most enjoyable on both nights. The staff were also obliging. The weather was against us on the Sunday as it rained all day. We had missed the 10am bus into Brodick and the owner of the hotel Knocked on our bedroom door offering us a lift other than that it would have a couple of hours before the next bus as they operate with ferry times so thanks to the owner again. Yes we will be back but will wait until the summer is here.
reviews.title: Would go back

reviews.text: We also visited the hotel on a Groupon deal which made it a reasonable cost for a winter break, we upgraded to a suite (room 10), which was clean and far more comfortable than I expected. The dining room was a bit cold and un-inviting but the meals were good. The only bar in the hotel is used by the locals and which was alright by me, but I did notice that there were very few hotel residents using it, I think it was because the seating was limited and very hard and uncomfortable and its something the management should consider changing. I liked the hotel and if I ever go back I would use it again, but a wet weekend in February on Arran is something I dont think I want to experience again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel recently for a couple of nights, our room was beautifull, it was clean & modern with a sea view, we slept ok & werent disturbed by any noise, the only negative thing I would say about the room, was that the water pressure for the shower was non existant, meaning the water just trickled out.
reviews.title: 100% for location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant once in the evening and found the food was ok, not brilliant. At breakfast time, the full english was ok but was clearly microwaved, possibly cooked the night before & heated in the microwave next day? from the dining area, the regular ping from the microwave could be heard, as peoples breakfasts were being heated up.
reviews.title: Lovely Location - beautifully situated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel (excluding the rooms) in general was nice, if a little tired & could certainly do with a few quid being spent on it & a bit of TLC. The rooms appear to have been modernised fairly recently.
reviews.title: Awesome location but...

description: Experience the luxury of our country hotel situated directly on the beach at the southern tip of the island, looking over panoramic views of Pladda Island, Ailsa Craig and beyond. Time stands still in this idyllic setting with otters & seals basking on the rocks right at our doorstep. Enjoy the beautiful grounds of the hotel with outdoor seating, and stone circle and of course the beach which is only a few steps away.
